cards.back:
Vo = (R2/R1)(Vi2 - Vi1)

Amplifies the DIFFERENCE between inputs.

How well the amp rejects common-mode signals.

CMRR = AD/Acm
Higher = better noise rejection.

Vd = Vi2 - Vi1

The actual signal we want to amplify.

Vcm = (Vi1 + Vi2)/2

The average of the inputs (often noise).

cards.front: Resistor matching condition for ideal diff amp?
cards.back:
R2/R1 = R4/R3

When ratios match perfectly, Acm = 0.

cards.front: Output of ideal diff amp when Vi1 = Vi2?
cards.back:
Zero!

Vo = AD(Vi2 - Vi1) = AD(0) = 0
Common-mode signals completely rejected.

cards.front: How to measure differential gain in lab?
cards.back:
1. Ground Vi1
2. Apply signal to Vi2
3. AD = Vo/Vi2

cards.front: How to measure common-mode gain in lab?
cards.back:
1. Connect same signal to BOTH inputs
2. Measure (small) output
3. Acm = Vo/Vcm = Vo/Vin

cards.front: Why might measured CMRR be lower than datasheet?
cards.back:
Resistor tolerance mismatch!

5% resistors → R2/R1 ≠ R4/R3 exactly
Solution: Use precision 0.1% resistors or instrumentation amp.
